intro: Stenostomum cahosianum, commonly known as the mountain stenostomum, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are simple, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four petals, and are adapted for insect pollination.
